intro: Tapirira pao-pombo var. major, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood. It is a species of flowering plant in the Anacardiaceae family, native to Brazil. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
